nodes.name: Retrieval-Augmented Generation
nodes.description: Augments LLMs with external knowledge retrieved at inference time.

nodes.name: Hippocampal Indexing Theory
nodes.description: Neuroscience theory where hippocampus binds neocortical patterns into memory indices.

nodes.name: Open Information Extraction
nodes.description: Extracts schemaless (subject, relation, object) triples from text using an LLM.

nodes.name: HippoRAG Knowledge Graph
nodes.description: Artificial hippocampal index built from OpenIE triples plus synonymy edges.

nodes.name: Synonymy Edges
nodes.description: Links similar but distinct nodes via retrieval encoder similarity (threshold 0.8).

nodes.name: Personalized PageRank
nodes.description: Biases PageRank toward query nodes to perform single-step multi-hop graph traversal.

nodes.name: Node Specificity
nodes.description: Inverse passage frequency weight that down-weights common nodes during retrieval.

nodes.name: Multi-hop Question Answering
nodes.description: QA requiring reasoning across multiple passages; HippoRAG solves it in one retrieval step.

nodes.name: Limitations & Future Work
nodes.description: Current reliance on LLM-based OpenIE and potential for online index updates.

edges.description: Hippocampal theory motivates the KG index design.
OpenIE triples form the KG nodes and edges.
Synonymy edges enrich the KG with soft coreference links.
KG structure is the substrate for PPR traversal.
Node specificity modulates PPR seed weights.
PPR achieves multi-hop retrieval in a single step.
HippoRAG extends standard RAG with a KG index.
Multi-hop success reveals remaining scaling challenges.
